intro: Hedyotis anamalayana, commonly known as the Malabar bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Hedyotis anamalayana is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests, where it plays a role in the ecosystem by providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
